elements.title: Annotation of epidemiological information in animal disease-related news articles: guidelines and manually labelled corpus (Newly published Datasets from Cirad Dataverse)

This dataset contains two files: (i) An annotated corpus ("epi_info_corpus.xlsx") containing 486 manually annotated sentences extracted from 32 animal disease-related news articles. These news articles were obtained from the database of an event-based biosurveillance system dedic...

elements.title: DATA4C+ - A thesaurus to define land management practices in agriculture and forestry for soil carbon storage (Newly published Datasets from Cirad Dataverse)

DATA4C+ is a thesaurus classifying and defining land management practices in agriculture and forestry for soil carbon storage. DATA4C+ thesaurus is focussed on land management practices identified in the scientific literature as drivers of soil organic carbon (SOC) changes. DATA4...

elements.title: Breeding phenology in the parsley frog, Pelodytes punctatus (Newly published Datasets from Cirad Dataverse)

Breeding phenology in the parsley frog, Pelodytes punctatus

Jourdan, Hélène, 2022, "Breeding phenology in the parsley frog, Pelodytes punctatus", https://doi.org/10.18167/DVN1/2TOXXV, CIRAD Dataverse, V1
This dataset contains all data collected during a 3 year-survey around Montpellier to study the breeding phenology and breeding success of the anuran Pelodytes punctatus.

This dataset comprises data from a systematic review done after a comprehensive literature search using Scopus, Web of Science, Ovid publisher and Google Scholar for peer-reviewed meta-analyses and systematic reviews up to early 2020 that reported on soil organic carbon. This glo...

Genotyping and phenotypic dataset for GWAS analysis of Phenomics of Rice Adaptation and Yield (PRAY) project conducted in China, Colombia, India, Phillipines, Senegal from 2011 to 2016. Genotyping matrix contains 208 631 SNPs x 281 accessions of PRAY project. Phenotypic data are...

elements.title: The Lozère: Hellhound on the Trail. (La Gazette de café du cycliste)
elements.contents:
ROULER

The Lozère: Hellhound on the Trail. Lozère in the Massif Central is typical of France Profonde. Connected by quiet and winding roads, there is very little traffic, a cyclist’s dream. One question, why is it so deserted?

elements.title: Ride of the Month: March. (La Gazette de café du cycliste)
elements.contents:
LA MAISON

Ride of the Month: March. In the world of cycle racing, Milan–San Remo is one of the most prestigious events of the season. To win this trophy is to have your name chiseled into history. But only if you’re a man.

elements.title: Coins Cachés: Lago di Como. (La Gazette de café du cycliste)
elements.contents:
ROULER

Coins Cachés: Lago di Como. At the convergence of the Lombardian flatlands and Italian alps lies Lago di Como. Beyond the glamourous waterside, there are roads leading to hundreds of wonderful divergences.

elements.title: Ride of the Month: February. (La Gazette de café du cycliste)
elements.contents:
LA MAISON

Ride of the Month: February. The Tour des Alpes Maritimes is an early test for hill racers. But we ourselves are not here to race. We’re here to discover what the Riviera has to offer the amateur cyclist.

elements.title: Caravan: Anton Krupicka (La Gazette de café du cycliste)
elements.contents:
LA MAISON

Caravan: Anton Krupicka I enjoy the adventure of cycling, especially bike packing, the multi-day trips. For me though, it’s just being in the outdoors, seeing beautiful landscapes and using your body.

elements.title: The Camargue – Between Sky and Sea. (La Gazette de café du cycliste)
elements.contents:
ROULER

The Camargue – Between Sky and Sea. There are places in the world that are sanctuaries for nature, where wildlife is untouched by modern life. The Camargue is one of those special places.

elements.title: Cycling and Creativity: Rémi Clermont. (La Gazette de café du cycliste)
elements.contents:
LA VIE

Cycling and Creativity: Rémi Clermont. Rémi Clermont is creative director of Café du Cycliste. Here he speaks about creativity, and the vital role his own cycling plays in the process.

elements.title: The Best Aligot in the World. (La Gazette de café du cycliste)
elements.contents:
LA VIE

The Best Aligot in the World. Aligot must be worked for a long time to obtain its very elastic texture. It is served with a sausage from pigs raised in the surrounding farmland of the Massif Central.

elements.title: Ride of the Month: January. (La Gazette de café du cycliste)
elements.contents:
LA MAISON

Ride of the Month: January. Exiting Nice from the north side, this ride provides a healthy mélange of architectural and natural landmarks, with a side of local legend.

elements.title: Coins Cachés: Boulder, Colorado. (La Gazette de café du cycliste)
elements.contents:
ROULER

Coins Cachés: Boulder, Colorado. Nestled on the eastern aspect of the foothills of the Colorado Rockies, the city of Boulder (population ~100,000) is a unique and idyllic hub for outdoor recreation—including cycling.

elements.title: Nissa La Bella Through the Seasons: The Lookbook. (La Gazette de café du cycliste)
elements.contents:
LA MAISON

Nissa La Bella Through the Seasons: The Lookbook. A city by the sea but not only. A place in the sun but not just. Nice is a cycling paradise twelve months a year and always, always, worth a visit.

elements.title: Cycling & Creativity: Sandra Sommer. (La Gazette de café du cycliste)
elements.contents:
LA VIE

Cycling & Creativity: Sandra Sommer. As an artist, Sandra knows that inspiration can strike when you least expect it. Her most recent project came to her while exploring the mountains around Salzburg as that is when her mind is most free.

elements.contents:
Otay Mountain Gravel Adventure Guide

The Otay Mountain Wilderness is located in San Diego, CA and the area is a great location to explore on a gravel bike with its long dirt road climbs and terrific views. In this Gravel Adventure Guide, we take a closer look at the region and offer a suggested gravel route to experience the mountain.
